name: AND Gate
description: A logical gate that outputs true only if all its inputs are true.

name: OR Gate
description: A logical gate that outputs true if any of its inputs are true.

name: NOT Gate
description: A logical gate that inverts the input signal.

name: NAND Gate
description: A logical gate that outputs false only if all its inputs are true.

name: NOR Gate
description: A logical gate that outputs false if any input is true

name: XNOR Gate
description: When both inputs are true or false, output is also false

name: XOR Gate
description: Returns true when number of true inputs is odd

name: Half Adder
description: A digital circuit that performs addition of two binary numbers.

name: Full Adder
description: A digital circuit that performs addition of three binary numbers.

name: Multiplexer
description: A digital circuit that selects one of many input signals and forwards it to the output.

name: SR Latch
description: The S input sets the output to 1, while the R input resets the output to 0. When both S and R are at 1, the latch is said to be in an “undefined” state

name: D FlipFlop
description: A digital circuit that stores a single bit of data.

name: JK FlipFlop
description: A digital circuit that combines the features of the SR and D flip-flops.
